Jekyll's autobuild feature

13 Jul 2017

I had one problem with my blog workflow: The manual building of the html with Jekyll. After I finished writing a post in Atom I would have had to manually execute jekyll serve in my shell before I could push the changes to GitHub.

But it doesn’t need to be like that. You can simply add this line to your _config.yml:
Atom:
      Jekyll: Toggle Auto Build

Now, whenever you save your article in Atom the html will be build automatically. Given the path to your Jekyll binary is set and recognized by Atom. I had to provide the full path in the Jekyll-Atom-plugin under “Settings”, “Build command”:
[path/to/your/jekyll/bin], build
